state_analysis: The command to remove the initramfs directory has timed out, indicating that the QEMU session is still running and causing the kernel to panic due to inability to mount the root filesystem. The process of cleanup is blocked by the active QEMU session.
explanation: Since the previous commands are still hanging due to the QEMU session, I will attempt to forcefully terminate the QEMU session and then recreate the initramfs from scratch. This will include ensuring the init script is properly configured before running QEMU again.

commands.keystrokes:
echo -e '#!/bin/sh
mount -t proc proc /proc
mount -t sysfs sys /sys
exec /bin/sh' > /tmp/initramfs/init/init
